properties.name: Boston, Mass:  5,819 census homeless (single day estimate) 2005
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog415 Summer St, Boston, MAfrom the website: "Many cities in the United States take an annual census of their homeless population, and use this data for decision making and also report it to the federal agency, HUD, as it is required for any city receiving federal monies for the homeless, especially for housing. The methods used for counting the number of homeless may vary from city to city.[18] December 2005 homeless estimates from major U.S. cities (single day estimate):[19] * Boston - 5,819 (total area population 569,165)~1.0% * Chicago - 6,715 (total area population 2,862,244)~0.2% * Denver - 5,000 (total population 580,000)~0.8% * Detroit - 14,827 (total area population 900,198)~1.6% * Los Angeles - 91,000 (total area population 3,300,000)~2.7% * New York - 48,155 (total area population 8,104,179)~0.5% * San Francisco - 6,248 (total area population 744,230)~0.8% * Seattle - 8,000 (total population 560,000)~1.4% * Washington DC - 5,518 (total area population 553,523)~0.9%"

properties.name: Chicago, IL: 6715 census homeless (single day estimate) 2005
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog2301 S Lake Shore Dr # 1001, Chicago, ILfrom the website: "Many cities in the United States take an annual census of their homeless population, and use this data for decision making and also report it to the federal agency, HUD, as it is required for any city receiving federal monies for the homeless, especially for housing. The methods used for counting the number of homeless may vary from city to city.[18] December 2005 homeless estimates from major U.S. cities (single day estimate):[19] * Boston - 5,819 (total area population 569,165)~1.0% * Chicago - 6,715 (total area population 2,862,244)~0.2% * Denver - 5,000 (total population 580,000)~0.8% * Detroit - 14,827 (total area population 900,198)~1.6% * Los Angeles - 91,000 (total area population 3,300,000)~2.7% * New York - 48,155 (total area population 8,104,179)~0.5% * San Francisco - 6,248 (total area population 744,230)~0.8% * Seattle - 8,000 (total population 560,000)~1.4% * Washington DC - 5,518 (total area population 553,523)~0.9%"

properties.name: Homeless woman with three children was here
properties.description: Posted by Poetdogall she had was an old car and some credit cards.

properties.name: Knoxville, TN: 1900 homeless anygiven month
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog701 Henley St, Knoxville, TNfrom estimated 800 per month in 1986 to 1900 per month in 2004. check out knoxville\'s 10-year plan to end chronic homelessness (available on the website).

properties.name: Los Angeles downtown: 1000-1300 homeless sleeping on the streets
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog719 N La Cienega Blvd, Los Angeles, CAfascinating mapping of homeless population in downtown LA. i\'d imagine the population is higher after christmas.

properties.name: NYC: 32,609 average anygiven night 2002-2005
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog120 Broadway Ste 3340, New York, NY"worst decade for homeless since great depression." large increases ni the number of children and families. about 13,000 children sleep in shelters any given night.

properties.name: Oahu, Hawaii: over 1000 homeless camping on beach
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog  87-199 Farrington Hwy, Waianae, HIDecember 5, 2006 NYTimes.com

properties.name: Ohio: 27,867 estimated homeless any given night in 2001
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog400 N High St, Columbus, OHfrom the website: "To determine the estimated point-in-time homeless population: As just reported, approximately 700,000 homeless people in this country on any given night are homeless. The country\'s total population for 2001 was 285 million. If you divide the estimated point-in-time homeless figure (700,000) by the total population (285 million), you can estimate that approximately .00245 percent of the country\'s total population experienced homelessness on any given night in 2001. If you apply that rationale to Ohio\'s total population (11, 374,541), you can estimate that 27,867 Ohioans experienced homelessness on any given night in 2001."

properties.name: Washington,DC:  14,537 homeless in 06/02
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog945 G St Nw, Washington, DCfrom the washington post article: "The fourth annual point-in-time survey counted 14,537 homeless men, women and children -- up 1.8 percent from last year\'s <2001> survey by the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments. ... The tally includes 11,386 people considered "literally homeless": living outdoors, in precarious housing or in transitional programs, or relying upon the area\'s patchwork of emergency shelters and services for help. An additional 3,151 are considered "permanently supported homeless," depending upon homeless services but in a stable setting."
